name: MAGIC ITEM (5): BLUE MATROYSHKA
description:
An inspired artisan of Russia made a set of nesting dolls from the wood of a Linden tree where two lovers had recently trysted, that was felled in the light of a full moon, in April of 1916.

The set was likely used as a charm to ensure the romantic and childbearing aspirations of a local village maiden and her soon to be betrothed. It is unknown whether they ever wed or had children, despite the sincere efforts of the magically inclined craftsman who was the girl's uncle.

This single doll is all that remains of his efforts, and is therefore imbued with all of the fertile and fecund power of the set concentrated into a single artifact.

This digital "token" confers upon you
a portion of the pro-creative romantic 
and para-natural power of this 
radiant meta-object.

Think on the maker of this physical item
and send them your gratitude
through the centuries - for the
privilege of holding it's
meta-verse avatar.

I took this photo and was blessed
by this object and the sincere
expression of it's maker.

I truly hope my photo gives a portion
of that warmth and comfort to you.

HPL
